item.title: Dawn add a quote by Diana Gabaldon
item.description: "Lying on the floor, with the carved panels of the ceiling flickering dimly above, I found myself thinking that I had always heretofore assumed that the tendency of eighÂ­teenth-century ladies to swoon was due to tight stays; now I rather thought it might be due to the idiocy of eighteenth-century men. " -- Diana Gabaldon

item.title: Dawn add a quote by Diana Gabaldon
item.description:
"A hedgehog? And just how does a hedgehog make love?" he demanded.
No, I thought. I won't. I will not. But I did. "Very carefully," I replied, giggling helplessly. So now we know just how old that one is, I thought. " -- Diana Gabaldon

item.title: Dawn add a quote by Diana Gabaldon
item.description:
"Then the room relaxed in cheers and babbling, and she turned in his arms to kiss him hard and cling to him, and he thought perhaps it didn't matter that they faced in opposite directions - so long as they faced each other.'
Roger Wakefield {Drums Of Autumn}" -- Diana Gabaldon

item.title: Dawn add a quote by Diana Gabaldon
item.description: "When the day shall come that we do part," he said softly, and turned to look at me, "if my last words are not 'I love you'-ye'll ken it was because I didna have time." -- Diana Gabaldon

item.title: Dawn add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Dawn add a quote by Narcotics Anonymous
item.description: "Insanity is doing the same thing, over and over again, but expecting different results." -- Narcotics Anonymous

item.title: Dawn add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Dawn add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Dawn add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Dawn add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "Marriage is a fine institution, but I'm not ready for an institution." -- Mae West

item.title: Dawn add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "I used to be Snow White, but I drifted." -- Mae West

item.title: Dawn add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "I'm single because I was born that way." -- Mae West

item.title: Dawn add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "Love conquers all things except poverty and toothache." -- Mae West

item.title: Dawn add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Dawn add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Friendship is born at that moment when one man says to another: "What! You too? I thought that no one but myself . . .&#34;" -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Dawn add a quote by Miss Piggy
item.description: "Beauty is in the eye of the beholder and it may be necessary from time to time to give a stupid or misinformed beholder a black eye." -- Miss Piggy

item.title: Dawn add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "Women and cats will do as they please, and men and dogs should relax and get used to the idea." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Dawn add a quote by Charles Schultz
item.description: "<b>I</b> love mankind ... it's <b>people</b> I can't stand!!" -- Charles Schultz

item.title: Dawn add a quote by robert heinlein
item.description: "Writing is not necessarily something to be ashamed of, but do it in private and wash your hands afterwards." -- robert heinlein

item.title: Dawn add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "Be wary of strong drink, it can make you shoot at the tax collector...and miss." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Dawn add a quote by Robert Heinlein
item.description: "Dad claims that library science is the foundation of all sciences just as math is the key -- and we will survive or founder, depending on how well the librarians do their jobs. Librarians didn't look glamorous to me but maybe Dad had hit on a not very obvious truth." -- Robert Heinlein

item.title: Dawn add a quote by Mercedes Lackey
item.description: "Truth and trust are the means by which civilization holds off barbarism." -- Mercedes Lackey

item.title: Dawn add a quote by Mercedes Lackey
item.description: "If it is stupid but it works, it isn't stupid. (a Shin'a'in saying)" -- Mercedes Lackey

item.title: Dawn add a quote by queen Elizabeth I
item.description: "I will have but one mistress and no master" -- queen Elizabeth I

item.title: Dawn add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Now the trouble about trying to make yourself stupider than you really are is that you very often succeed." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Dawn add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Eating and reading are two pleasures that combine admirably." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Dawn add a quote by C. S. Lewis
item.description: "Of all tyrannies, a tyranny sincerely exercised for the good of its victims may be the most oppressive. It would be better to live under robber barons than under omnipotent moral busybodies. The robber baron's cruelty may sometimes sleep, his cupidity may at some point be satiated; but those who torment us for our own good will torment us without end for they do so with the approval of their own conscience." -- C. S. Lewis

item.title: Dawn add a quote by William Goldman
item.description: "Life is pain, highness. Anyone who says differently is selling something." -- William Goldman

item.title: Dawn add a quote by William Goldman
item.description: "When I was your age, television was called books." -- William Goldman

item.title: Dawn add a quote by Marilyn Monroe
item.description: "I'm selfish, impatient and a little insecure. I make mistakes, I am out of control and at times hard to handle. But if you can't handle me at my worst, then you sure as hell don't deserve me at my best." -- Marilyn Monroe
